snippet: Islamist militants linked to Al Qaeda are trying to institute a strict version of Islamic law in northern Mali, and leading rebel officials say they will only confront the Islamists with Western assistance.
abstract: Hundreds of refugees fleeing Islamist takeover of northern Mali continue to arrive in Mauritania every day, but exiled nomadic rebel group pushed out by Islamist fighters linked to Al Qaeda says they are not the ones to take on the Islamists; Western nations, notably France, the former colonial power in Mali, continue to suggest that any military resolution to Mali’s crisis must come from Africans themselves.
lead_paragraph: Islamist militants linked to Al Qaeda are trying to institute a strict version of Islamic law in northern Mali, and leading rebel officials say they will only confront the Islamists with Western assistance.

headline.main: As Refugees Flee Islamists in Mali, Solutions Are Elusive
headline.print_headline: As Refugees Flee Islamists in Mali, Solutions Are Elusive
